title: Smart AI Footstep Electricity Generation IoT Dashboard

requirements.text: Create a backend actor that stores and manages simulated IoT sensor data including: footstep count per hour, voltage generated (in watts), battery level percentage (0–100%), current AI mode (charging / redirecting to devices / using stored energy), and timestamped historical records for analytics.

quotes: IOT sends data how many steps how much electricity produced It analyzes data collected from IOT sensors number of footsteps,voltage generated battery level

acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores footstep count, voltage, battery level, and AI mode as stable state
Historical records are stored with timestamps
API endpoints exist to read current sensor state and historical data
API endpoint exists to advance/simulate the sensor tick (increment time, update readings)

requirements.text: Implement AI energy management logic in the backend that: stops charging when battery level exceeds 90% (overcharge prevention), reroutes power directly to devices/lights when battery is full, draws from stored battery energy during low-traffic periods, and determines current mode based on footstep count and battery level.

quotes: ai stops charging is full to avoid damage and energy loss
if battery is almost full it sends power directly to lights or devices instead of wasting it

acceptanceCriteria: When battery >= 90%, AI mode switches to 'Redirecting to Devices'
When battery < 20% and footsteps are low, AI mode switches to 'Using Stored Energy'
When battery is between 20–90%, AI mode is 'Charging Battery'
AI mode is recalculated on every simulated sensor tick

requirements.text: Implement time-of-day traffic pattern simulation in the backend: morning hours (6am–12pm) produce high footstep counts (80–150 steps/min) and high voltage; afternoon hours (12pm–6pm) produce lower footstep counts (30–70 steps/min) and lower voltage; evening/night hours produce minimal activity. The simulation should auto-tick every few seconds to advance sensor readings.

quotes: if ai learns morning = many steps(more power) afternoon = fewer footsteps(less power then it stores more energy during busy time uses stored energy during low traffic time

acceptanceCriteria: Simulated footstep and voltage values differ by time-of-day period
Morning period shows significantly higher readings than afternoon
Sensor data auto-updates at regular intervals to simulate live feed
Historical data accumulates over the session to feed analytics

requirements.text: Build a real-time IoT sensor data display panel on the frontend showing: current footstep count (steps/min), current voltage generated (W), battery level as a percentage with a visual progress bar, and current AI mode with a color-coded status badge (green = charging, amber = redirecting, blue = using stored).

quotes: Display live/simulated sensor data: footstep count, voltage generated, battery level

acceptanceCriteria: Live sensor values update automatically (polling every 3–5 seconds)
Battery level shown as a percentage progress bar with color changes at thresholds
AI mode badge is color-coded and updates in real time
Footstep and voltage readings are clearly labeled with units

requirements.text: Build an AI Smart Energy Management decision panel on the frontend that shows the current AI decision with explanation text (e.g., 'Battery is 95% full — redirecting power to lights and devices'), overcharge protection status indicator, and a log of recent AI decisions with timestamps.

quotes: AI decision panel showing current mode (charging / direct supply / storing)
Overcharge protection status (AI stops charging when battery is full)

acceptanceCriteria: Current AI decision is displayed with a human-readable explanation
Overcharge protection shows as active/inactive with visual indicator
Recent AI decision log shows last 10 decisions with timestamps
Panel updates in real time as AI mode changes

requirements.text: Build an animated energy flow diagram on the frontend that visually shows the power path: Footsteps → Generator → Battery → Devices/Lights. Highlight the active path based on current AI mode (e.g., when battery is full, highlight the Battery → Devices path; when charging, highlight the Generator → Battery path).

quotes: Energy flow diagram showing path: Footsteps → Generator → Battery → Devices/Lights

acceptanceCriteria: Diagram shows all four nodes: Footsteps, Generator, Battery, Devices/Lights
Active energy path is visually highlighted (glowing or animated arrows)
Inactive paths are dimmed
Diagram updates when AI mode changes

requirements.text: Build analytics charts on the frontend showing: (1) hourly footstep count over the last 24 simulated hours as a bar chart, (2) energy generated (voltage) over time as a line chart, and (3) battery level trend over time as a line chart. Charts should update as new data arrives.

quotes: Analytics charts: daily/hourly footstep count, energy generation over time, battery level trends

acceptanceCriteria: Three separate charts are displayed in the analytics section
Footstep chart shows per-hour data as a bar chart
Energy and battery charts show trend lines over time
Charts update when new historical data is available
Morning vs afternoon contrast is visible in the footstep chart

requirements.text: Apply a bold industrial/tech visual theme across the entire dashboard: dark background with neon accent colors (amber/green/cyan), large data readout typography, card-based layout with subtle glowing borders, and a header displaying the project title 'Smart AI Footstep Energy System'. The design should feel like a professional engineering control room dashboard.
acceptanceCriteria: Dark background is used throughout the app
Accent colors (amber, green, cyan) are applied consistently to highlights and badges
Header displays the project title clearly
Layout uses a card-based grid appropriate for a control room dashboard
Typography is clean and data-readout styled for sensor values

constraints: All sensor data simulation must happen within the single Motoko backend actor
No external IoT hardware or real sensor APIs — all data is simulated
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui
nonGoals: Connecting to real physical IoT sensors or hardware

required: Glowing footstep icon on dark background with electric energy effect (footstep-icon.dim_128x128.png)
Dark industrial control room banner with circuit board pattern and subtle amber glow (dashboard-banner.dim_1200x200.png)
